title: sabina nessa six unanswered questions
story: :root Sabina Nessa murder:  unanswered questions in hunt for killer as CCTV releasedDetectives are racing to solve the murder of Sabina Nessa, , a south London teacher killed as she set out on a walk through Cator Park in the South London borough of GreenwichSabina Nessa Image: PAByTalia ShadwellReporter:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep The public is being urged to share CCTV images of a mystery man and a silver car in hopes of bringing schoolteacher Sabina Nessaaposs killer to justice. Scotland Yard is appealing for help as detectives work around the clock to solve the -year-oldaposs murder in south London. Sabinaaposs death has led to widespread grief and amplied concerns about womenaposs safety after she was killed as she was about to set out on what should have been a five-minute walk. Sabina had left her Kidbrooke home to make the short journey across a park to a pub to meet a date at around .pm Friday when she vanished. A dog walker discovered her body under a pile of leaves at a park the following day. Sabina was described as “beautul, talented and caring” by her grieving sister. Pals said the talented young woman had dreams of moving abroad to teach in Dubai.  Where did she vanish  Detectives say Sabina, a teacher at the Rushey Green Primary School in Lewisham, set out on what would have been a five-minute journey to meet a friend at a pub in Kidbrooke Village, south London, at around .pm Friday. Her short journey would have taken her about  minutes from her Astell Rd home across Cator Park to get to The Depot in Pegler Square. Pals have said she was excited about going on a date with an old friend that evening at the bar. But she never arrived. Sabina was not reported missing by anyone after failing to show up to the bar. Adog walker found her body near a walkway close to the OneSpace community centre in Cator Park, Kidbrooke, in the Royal Borough of Greenwich at around .pm Saturday, under a pile of leaves. Police have not yet said publicly at what point of the journey she is believed to have been attacked.  What was the cause of death  A post-mortem carried out at Greenwich Mortuary proved to be inconclusive, police said on Monday. Detectives have said they believe she was hit with a heavy object and was taken to Cator Park, where her body was found. A Met Police spokesman said the force is not commenting on the reporting on the suspected murder weapon.Who killed her Police have said they were keeping an open mind on a motive to the killing, which has been widely reported as a suspected stranger attack Speaking at the scene where tributes had been laid to Sabina next to the police cordon at Cator Park on Thursday, Detective Chief Superintendent Trevor Lawry said earlier he is “keeping a completely open mind” on what the motive of the attacker may have been.  Asked whether detectives were worried the killer could attack someone , he said: “We have lines of inquiry that we’re pursuing at the moment. “It’s always a concern that it may happen, but that’s not something that we have any intelligence on at this time.” Asked whether he believed the killing was a stranger attack, DCI Lawry told reporters:“That’s definitely a line of inquiry that we’re looking at.” Sabinaaposs flatmate, speaking on condition of anonymity, told reporters she feels unsafe after losing her friend. Her fearful housemate of four months said she had last seen Sabina when the pair hung out and took pictures together.She told: ‘I never thought something like this could happen to her. I had been texting her and it’s not like her to not reply to my messages.“I don’t feel safe living here now.”  Who is the man in the CCTV images  Police say CCTV images of a man seen walking through south London is another person they would like to speak to. The force says the unknown man was in the area at the time of the attack, as well as pictures of a silver car they believe he has access to. The images of the man, taken from CCTV, shows him walking in Pegler Square, south London, on the evening Sabina was attacked. Where is the mystery car captured on CCTV going  Police have also released an image of the car they believe the man has access to, which was also captured in the Pegler Square area. Police are urging anyone who recognises the man and vehicle to make contact immediately. They have not revealed any more detail yet about exactly where or when the car was seen or what direction it was heading. However they have said they are appealing for sightings of the man and car across the south London borough of Greenwich, including in Catford, Kidbrooke and Greenwich itself. Have arrests been made  A man in his s was arrested on suspicion of murder at an address in Lewisham on Saturday evening, and was later released under police investigation. The politan Police announced on Thursday that a second, -year-old man had been arrested at an address in Lewisham on suspicion of Sabinaaposs murder and was being held in custody.  What you can you to help Police want to speak to anyone who may have seen anything that could help their investigation. Anyone who recognises the man in the CCTV images or has seen him in recent days is being urged to contact the Met. Detective Chief Inspector Neil John, from the Metaposs Specialist Crime Command, said: Our team have been working tirelessly to find the person responsible for Sabinaaposs murder and this has included an extensive trawl of CCTV, work which remains ongoing. We would ask anyone - especially those in Kidbrooke and the wider area of Lewisham and Greenwich - to take a careful look at these images to check whether you know who this man is or have seen him over recent days. Any information as to his identity or whereabouts could be vital for our investigation so we are asking you to share this image far and wide to ensure as many people as possible see it.  Where to attend the vigil for Sabina Nessa Vigils are being held for Sabina in locations around London later on Friday, and people are being encouraged to light candles on their doorsteps. Reclaim the Streets, a campaign group calling for an end to male violence against women, involved in organising previous vigils, said it is “angry and heartbroken” about her murder. Sabinaaposs death comes after the killings of Sarah Everard, who was knidnapped and murdered by a Met cop as she walked home, and sisters Bibaa Henry, Nicole Smallman, who were stabbed to death in a park. ‘I don’t feel safe living here now.’ Sabinaaposs community of Kidbrooke in Greenwich have organised a vigil at pm on Friday evening in Pegler Square, with the support of Reclaim these Streets. The vigil will be held to remember Sabina, how she lived and the lives she transformed as campaigners demand womenaposs rights to safety, the campaign group says. Anyone with information on the Sabina Ness case should call the Met Police incident room on    or Crimestoppers completely anonymously on   .Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Sabina NessaMurderCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news sabina-nessa-vigil-how-take-"Sadiq Khan pays tribute to murdered teacher Sabina NessaByAndrea Oldereide:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep  On Friday,  September, at what is believed to be around .pm, Sabina Nessa, a -year-old primary school teacher, was meant to meet a friend after taking a five-minute long walk through a southeast London park – she never finished her short walk.Sabina’s body was found on a Saturday afternoon - September  - in Cator Park near OneSpace community centre on Kidbrooke Park Road in southeast London, and police were called just after .pm. Sabina has been a teacher at Rushney Green Primary School in Catford, having joined the school in July . The death of the woman, who was described as being “kind, caring and absolutely dedicated to her pupils”, highlights another attack that happened earlier this year and is all too similar: the murder of Sarah Everard, also killed in London while on her walk.When is the Sabina Nessa vigil  With this in mind, the Reclaim These Streetscollective has organised a vigil to be held at pm this Fridayin Peglar square.  The collective tweeted: “Sabinaaposs journey was meant to be  minutes long at : as she was en route to meet a friend just as many of us do. “On Friday night, we will join Sabina Nessa’s community in solidarity against violence against women and to acknowledge her le. “Please join the Kidbrooke community as we pay our respects. “A candlelight vigil is planned. Please feel free to bring your own candle.”  RTS has encouraged people to light a candle on their doorstep at pm,they cannot join in person. How to take part in Sabina Nessa vigil The resistance movement has also shared other vigils to be held across the country: Brighton: Friday,  September at pm in the Valley Gardens Manchester: Friday,  September at pm, location TBA Cardf: Friday,  September at pm, at the Grangetown Pavilion Portsmouth: Saturday,  September at pm, at Portsmouth Guildhall Square Newcastle: Friday,  September at pm at Grey’s Monument Ipswich: online Friday pm Ealing: Friday,  September at pm at Ealing Town Hall Stroud: Friday,  September at pm outside the Stroud subscription rooms, Gloucestershire Derby: Friday,  September at pm, online Haringy: Friday,  September from pm to pm outside the Wood Green Library Frome: Friday,  September at pm, location TBA Somerset: Friday,  September at pm, location TBA East London: Friday,  September at pm, in Victoria Park The politan police is looking for people to help them identy a man caught on CCTV that may be linked to Sabina’s murder, as well as a car, and any additional information or observations. Call the METyou have observed anything suspicious in relation to Sabina’s murder:   Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Sabina Nessa" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: simple staircase test can tell
story: :root Simple staircase test can tell how much youre at risk of deadly heart diseaseHeart disease is one of the UKs deadliest killers as the British Heart Foundation say heart and circulatory diseases cause a quarter of all deaths in the countryExperts say to do a stair test to seeyou are at risk of heart disease Image: Getty Images MaskotByJames RodgerRegional Content EditorAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Sep | commentsHealth experts are urging people to do a simple stair test to seethey are at risk of heart disease.It has been suggested one of the UKaposs deadliest killers can be detected by walking up the stairs, BirminghamLive reports.Heart and circulatory diseases cause a quarter of all deaths in the UK, thataposs more than , deaths each year – or one death every three minutes, according to the British Heart Foundation. To perform the test, try and walk up four flights of stairs. If you are able to trek up the flights without trouble, youaposre not a risk, a study says.  Experts and researchers from the University Hospital A Coruna in Spain believe those who can manage the feat in less than a minute have better heart . Lead author Dr Jesus Peteiro, a cardiologist at University Hospital A Coruna, Spain, said: The stairs test is an easy way to check your heart health. If it takes you more than one-and-a-half minutes to ascend four flights of stairs, your health is suboptimal, and it would be a good idea to consult a doctor.  The main symptoms of coronary heart disease are: chest pain, shortness of breath and pain throughout the body, as well as feeling faint and also feeling sick . Last week, it was revealed in a study during a follow-up of almost  years of adults with hearts disease that continued low physical activity was linked to  per cent lower risk of dying from any cause. And sustained high physical activity was linked to a  per cent lower risk of death compared to those who are inactive, the Nord-Trondelag Health Study found.Coronary heart diseaseis a major cause of death in the UK and worldwide. CHD is sometimes called ischaemic heart disease or coronary artery disease. The main symptoms of coronary heart disease are:chest painshortness of breath pain throughout the body feeling faint feeling sick Coronary heart disease can develop when your heartaposs blood supply is blocked or interrupted by a build-up of fatty substances in the coronary arteries. The process - atherosclerosis - is when the walls of your arteries can become furred up with fatty deposits, which are called atheroma. Atherosclerosis can be caused by lestyle factors, such as smoking and regularly drinking excessive amounts of alcohol. Source: NHS There are about .million people living with heart and circulatory diseases in the UK, according to the British Heart Foundation. Speak to your GPyou think you could be at risk for heart disease.You can expect to be asked about your medical history, have your blood pressure checked and have a blood test done.Comment MORE ON British Heart FoundationUniversity HospitalHospitalsBlood pressureHeart disease" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: texting deceased loved one softens
story: :root Texting a deceased loved one "softens the harsh reality" says psychologistWhile before it may have been listening to an old answer phone message, now this modern coping mechanism is a new comfort for the bereavedHave you ever sent a text to a deceased loved one  Image: GettyByEmily Sleight:,  Sep | commentsLosing someone close to us can be extremely dficult - and many of us have dferent ways of coping with the grief. It’s important to note that everyone copes with grief in dferent ways, and there is no real right or wrong in the grieving process.With digital reminders of your loved one on social media s like Facebook and Instagram, things can get really tough. Although there are ways to turn off the profiles, you may still miss their online presence and knowing that they are a short message away for a quick chat.Reopening old text messages are bound to bring up many emotions, but what about those who continue to text their loved one  It’s now a common coping mechanism, and experts say it can actually be useful for those to deal with the transition. When considering why many people do this to cope with their loss, psychologist Ingrid Collins said: “When a loved one dies, we find it hard to adjust immediately to the fact that they are no longer physically with us. “In the first stages of grief, we tend to become emotionally numb as a result of the trauma of bereavement, often finding it dficult to accept that they are really gone.”FRisk is a wakeup call for the millions of people with no will or protection in place for their own death. FRisk is a FREE intuitive app that produces a FRisk Score confirming the level of risk your family and loved ones face were you to die without effective planning in place. Use Frisk to find out your own personal FRisk Score including: What would happen to your children  Who’s entitled to your estate  Who can bring claims  How much tax would you pay  What about your pets and your digital estate  Plus much more. Get your FREE FRisk Score now by clicking here. It is in this phase that many find it comforting to ease adjustment to a loss by continuing on a conversation. Ingrid continued: “Be it imaginary, as some believe, or communicating with the lingering soul of the loved one, as others believe. “Either way, it is a way of softening the harsh reality of never being in their physical presence again.  As a culture, it’s no doubt that we are taught to cope well with bereavement, with a “stf upper lip” approach for many. To some, that may signy that the inidual may not be coping well at all, and bottling up any emotions from others. When talking about text messaging loved ones that have passed away, Ingrid said: “Any method that enables us to prolong the comfort of the relationship with the deceased or,the bond was challenging, to go some way to resolving the relationship, is to be welcomed. “Sometimes people cling on to their loved one’s physical possessions that serve as a reminder. “This is one way of adjusting. Some take up a campaign in order to bring some meaning to what might otherwise appear to be a random or supposedly preventable death.” In short, those who choose to communicate with a deceased person are “taking an effective shortcut to arriving at some measure of acceptance.” Comment MORE ON GrievingText messagesFrisk" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news two-britains-worst-fly-tippers-"Footages shows extent of fly tipping in NewportByChiara Fiorillo:,  Sep | commentsTwo of Britainaposs worst fly-tippers have been caught on camera while dumping rubbish on deserted roads. Bradley Lynn, , and Connor Williams, , have been filmed carrying stacks of waste to leave at deserted roadsides. Environment chiefs launched an investigation to find the fly-tippers after they used fake number plates to carry out the crimes. CCTV footage shows Lynn and Williams apparently travelling in an untaxed and unregistered tipper van. The pair were spotted dumping rubbish at a former LG site in Newport, South Wales, in September and October last year. The site has been dubbed the Road to Nowhere as it has become a hotspot for fly-tipping.  Lynn, of Splott, Cardf, and Williams, of Trowbridge, pleaded guilty to an offence under the Environmental Protection Act . Magistrates in Newport fined each man £ and ordered them to pay costs of £, and a victimaposs surcharge of £. Newport city council said it worked with Gwent Police and Fly Tipping Action Wales to bring them to court.  After the case, Councillor Roger Jeavons said: I would like to thank the public for providing information that led to the identication of these two people. As well as fines, they could have faced being sent to prison for this crime and I hope this prosecution will act as a deterrent to others who illicitly dump waste. Residents should also note thatthey employ others to clear waste and itaposs not disposed of legally then they would also be liable and could be prosecuted.  We will not hesitate to take action against those who deliberately dump refuse on our land. It is a crime that blights our communities, the city and our environment and it will not be tolerated. news uk-news uk-weather-forecast-exact-date-"UK weather: Warm weekend with lots of cloud expectedByChiara Fiorillo:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsBrits have been enjoying warm temperatures this week, with the mercury reaching highs of C in southern parts of the UK. There will be three more days of sunshine - Friday, Saturday and Sunday - before the weather turns cooler next week. The mini-heatwave has only affected southern parts of the country, while northern areas have experienced strong winds and heavy rain. The best conditions and high temperatures will be felt in the east and central parts of the UK over the next few days, according to the Met Office. Met Office meteorologist Alex Deakin said: “Plenty more sunshine across much of the country today.  “Much of southern Scotland and certainly most of England and Wales will have another fine day of September sunshine. “Temperatures are responding to that sunshine, heading up into the low twenties - C, maybe C across parts of the south east.” But the early autumn sunshine will only continue for a few more days before torrential rain and gales hit Britain and temperatures turn cooler. The Met Office said that at the beginning of next week Brits will see a sht in weather conditions.An active weather front will bring heavy rain and blustery winds as it pushes in from the west across the UK, forecasters said. Meteorologist Adam Thornhill said: For the rest of this week and for the weekend, we will continue to see low pressure systems bringing blustery weather to the north of the UK whereas further south the drier, warmer weather remains thanks to the influence of high pressure extending up from the Azores. However, a sht in the position of the jet stream brings a change in our weather next week, allowing a cold front associated with a low-pressure system in the North Atlantic to spread eastwards bringing wet and windy conditions across the whole country throughout Monday.  Behind the cold front, conditions will feel much more autumnal with a cooler feel and blustery showers for many. Next week, gusty winds will create a more autumnal feel across many areas of the country. The Met Office said the weather will turn cooler from Monday, but temperatures are expected to slowly recover to above average as we move into October. UK  day weather forecast This Evening and Tonight: Some rain crossing Scotland, with low cloud, mist and drizzle also spreading to some western areas later. Further south and east, some clear spells, and for southern and central England the chance of some fog patches. Windy in the north. Friday: Low cloud and drizzle continuing to affect some areas especially parts of the west and southwest, though some sunshine east of hills. Further east, a better share of warm sunshine. Outlook for Saturday to Monday: Mainly fine and warm Saturday. Some rain for the northwest. Scattered showers overnight into Sunday, perhaps heavy in the southeast. Squally band of rain pushes east Sunday and into Monday.Most ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON WeatherMet Office" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: we deserve certain minimum teacher
story: :root We all deserve a certain minimum - teacher reveals sad incident that opened her eyes to hygiene povertyBoots and charity The Hygiene Bank are working together to stop pupils going without the basics - heres how you can helpAdvertorialByLaura Tait:,  Sep Contending with fidgety, distracted children is standard practice for teachers. But it was the reason why one particular child couldn’t focus that changed everything for deputy head-teacher Rebekah Wilson.“A boy in my class didn’t seem his normal happy self and he couldn’t concentrate for scratching his stomach,” says -year-old Rebekah, known as Bex. “He told me he didn’t have a bed at home, and the cushion he shared with his brother to sleep on was infested with bed bugs.”This was the moment that Bex, who works at an inner city primary school in Leeds, realised the impact that hygiene could have on her pupils and their education. “Times are hard for some families who are having to choose what they can do without,” she says. “Hygiene items often get sacriced. We’re not talking luxuries here, just the absolute basics like toilet roll, shampoo, deodorant, shower gel and soap. “Going without these things affects kids’ self-esteem. Imagine what it’s likeyou can’t keep yourself clean or you don’t have clean clothes  It can really stop children learning, engaging and taking part at school and it can lead to bullying or them being singled out.” Happily there’s an organisation that’s helping to relieve the pressure. The Hygiene Bank, which stresses that being clean is a basic human right, collects new, unused, in-date personal care and household cleaning essentials and distributes them to families in need through schools like Bex’s and charities.  And Boots has been supporting The Hygiene Bank by hosting more than  banks in stores across the UK where customers can donate their own hygiene products. The retailer then donates four products for every kilogram that has been donated. Toothbrushes and toothpaste are two items Bex knows are particularly needed. “So many children are coming to school with tooth problems now,” she says. “Bad dental health can cause a lot of pain and distress and really affect children’s confidence.” But something as simple as shampoo or shower gel can also improve the wellbeing and happiness of those struggling to stay afloat. “I had a mum in tears the other day because we’d given her a hygiene package that included some shower gel. As little as a p bottle can make a dference. She said it felt like Christmas.” Another mum had just £ left for her weekly shopping. “She needed nappies, washing powder and washing up liquid. She didn’t know what to buy because she knew she couldn’t get it all.” Hygiene products provided through The Hygiene Bank across the UK help fill the gap. “We all deserve a certain minimum,” says Bex. “We need to ensure every family has access to these basics, and remove the stigma of asking for support, making sure that families are treated with respect.” Boots leads big donation drive Boots and charity The Hygiene Bank are working together to provide much-needed hygiene and personal care products to people living in poverty.  In the last year, Boots, which has more than  donation points in stores across the UK, has given more than , items – from toothpaste to shower gel, soap to shampoo – to hundreds of communities and charities across the UK. Boots donates hygiene products to The Hygiene Bank. And since it believes every child has the right to feel good when they go back to school, Boots has also worked with the charity to design educational resources for parents and teachers to help young people understand hygiene and hygiene poverty. In its ‘You donate  we donate’ initiative, Boots gives four products for every kilogram of items donated to The Hygiene Bank in Boots stores.You can donate at your local Boots donation point, through the boots e-voucher scheme, and directly to The Hygiene Bank. Products are distributed to those who need them via schools, charities, council services and voluntary organisations. Milford on Sea Boots Store Manager Charlotte Whiteside says: “We’re very grateful for anything that our kind-hearted customers donate – but essentials include shampoo, toothpaste and sanitary products.” Shampoo Deodorant Toilet roll Period products Toothpaste Toothbrush Soap Nappies

news uk-news why-stormed-good-morning-britain-"GMB: Richard Madeley criticises activist over M protestopinionByLiam Norton:,  Sep | comments On Wednesday I appeared on Good Morning Britain. It all got a bit heated.I was prepared to be called a hypocrite, a fascist and to be asked why I don’t go to China to be shot at . I’ve been managing quite well during the last few weeks to stay calm during the barrage of questions that have been coming my way. People have been quite rightly furious and upset by what we are doing and I accept that. What frustrated me on Wednesday was the refusal by the other people on the programme to accept the physical reality we are in. The reality that Sir David King means when he says, “What we do in the next three to four years will determine the future of humanity”. That’s the reason I’m on the telly sitting through that rage and anger. It is because I really care about the country I live in and all the people who live here. Do you agree with Insulate Britainaposs actions  Have your say in the comments below  What the GMB presenters are not ready to accept is that climate breakdown isn’t primarily about survival of polar bears and dolphins, as important as they are, but about the survival of our economy, our NHS and of the very fabric of our society. This means many people will suffer.  What Insulate Britainis asking for is to conserve our society. To do that at this time means having to make some tough decisions, we understand that. The comparisons to Churchill on the programme upset Richard Madeley. I wasn’t saying that IB were the same as Churchill, what I was saying was that there were some similarities. The people that didn’t want to oppose Hitler were seen as appeasing Hitler. Churchill understood that you either faced up to the reality now or you paid for it later. He had the support of just six MPs. That meant that  million people lost their lives. It was locked in. There is a similarity now. If we don’t move as rapidly as Sir David King says we should, the suffering of millions of people in the next few decades will be locked in, unstoppable. What was happening on GMB on Wednesday was appeasement. A refusal to accept the reality, while also turning their anger of that reality onto me. Well we feel angry too. Angry that our government has ignored our letters, petitions and protests for  years.Insulating our homes is our line in the sand and we will not let them cross it. It gives the best value for money in terms of CO emissions, will provide hundreds of thousands of meaningful jobs and will stop tens of thousands of our elderly from freezing to death each winter and means families can heat and eat. This isnapost aboutmy home is insulated or not. Itaposs not about whether Iaposm a hypocrite for calling for all homes to be insulated. Itaposs about how tackling the climate crisis will not only save our country from destruction, but also benefit millions of our citizens and bring them out of fuel poverty. Itaposs a win-win. What Richard and Susanna don’t seem to understand is thatthe government continues to ignore us, it will get much more heated. news uk-news woman--can-blow-out-"Woman blows out candles through eye socket after eyeball removedByRia Newman:,  Sep | commentsA woman can blow out candles through her eye socket after having her eyeball removed due to a rare deadly cancer. Emma Cousins, , from Sheffield, has been living with one eye after being diagnosed with mesenchymal chondrosarcoma in April . She had noticed her left eye appearing to grow and bulge and shortly after her daughteraposs second birthday she went to AE to get checked out as she started to feel unwell. Emma, who is mum to an -year-old son and five-year-old daughter, said: “My eye felt stretched and I felt sick. “The doctor thought it was a small bleed so I saw an out of hours optician who askedI had any selfies on my phone.  “I had six years’ worth of pictures so I showed the optician, who asked to see pictures of me from further back. “It was at that point I thought ‘oh no something is wrong’. I managed to find pictures of me at . “The optician said he didn’t know for sure but that it looked like something had been growing behind my eye since I was .” Looking at the images side-by-side, Emma could see a subtle dference as her eye appeared to grow and bulge over time. She was booked in for an MRI scan which found a large tumour growing behind her eye and in April  a biopsy was taken to seeit could be salvaged.  Sadly, nothing could be done and she was diagnosed with a form of sarcoma cancer – and told she would lose her eye. Emma said: “I thought ‘no, it can’t be, I’m too young’ and the doctor was acting very nervous. “The doctor said ‘the eye will have to come out’ and told me I’m the only person in England with it, and that chemotherapy wouldn’t work.“He told me not to Google it but obviously that was the first thing I did when I was alone.“I wish I had listened as all I could find were pages saying it spreads to the lungs and you die. “After reading that it made me panic and the reality kicked in – I was going to lose my eye and I had cancer.” Over the following weeks, surgeons planned the tricky, warning Emma that, while they would remove as much of the tumour as possible, she would be left disfigured. Emma said: “I had to tell my children because, with my eye going, I couldn’t hide it from them. “I told them I needed to have my eye removed then I would be better.” In June , she had her eyeball removed in a terrying procedure. Emma said: “I was nervous but knowing I had cancer and how bad it could be made me feel better about it. “Losing an eye for a chance of saving my le was a risk I was willing to take. “I think one of the worst things was  minutes before the eye removal, one of the nurses drew an arrow on my forehead to highlight which eye it was – and for the rest of my time left with two eyes I was panicking they would take the wrong eye out by mistake. “My main concern was what would happen with the kids – my daughter was so young at the time, so she wouldn’t remember anything about me.” Thankfully, Emma made it through the tough surgery and started a six-week course of radiation therapy, which caused burns to her skin. Sadly, she had a reaction to the treatment and ended up in ICU connected to a ventilator as she fought off the debilitating symptoms linked to fulminant multiple sclerosis, which left her “completely paralysed”. She said: “I couldn’t even talk – it was like being completely locked in my own body, unable to communicate anything. “Doctors told my family I would die, but to their surprise I regained the ability to talk, my arms started to work, and I have slowly recovered to the point I can now walk myself – although not as well as I used to.”  Her medics were left equally baffled by the adverse reaction and much is still unclear about why Emma suffered so much post-surgery. As soon as she saw herself with one eye, Emma realised she looked “dferent to anybody ”. She said: “The first thing I can remember thinking was ‘wow it doesn’t look as bad as I thought’. “It was still a few months before it all settled and the bruising had gone down, but it looked so much nicer than I had presumed it would look. “I actually liked it because everything has been done now with hair and makeup, whereas everyone notices how dferent I look – and I try to live up to that with my eye patches. “After all, they are going to stare at me anyway, so why not give them something to stare at ” Later that month in June , Emma was referred to have a prosthetic eye made, but found it to look “fake” and be too much “faff”, so opted instead to wear glasses and eye patches. Over time, a small hole developed in her empty socket – which doctors believe was caused by the radiation – that has been widened. Emma said: “Because the radiation has killed veins in my socket they supply the skin with blood and because blood cannot get to the area the skin dies and that’s what the hole is. “I’ve waited over a year for the operation but now the hole is getting bigger simple things like having a shower or being in heavy rain can drown me. “As the hole is directly connected to my lungs – meaning anything going in my eye can enter my lungs. “I have to stay away from a swimming pool and baths as I could drown.” Her children have been incredibly supportive, as Emma explained: “They have been wonderful. When the hole first appeared to now, they have had to see it grow in size but have been great at adapting – even though it has meant no swimming, which they love. “I don’t think they realise just how good they have been throughout all of this. “They have had to grow up so fast and seen daily not only how big the hole is getting, but my daily struggle to recover.” Despite her suffering, she has received global attention on TikTok, after taking to the social media  to share videos of her empty socket. One video received  million views, with thousands of fans cheering her on. One person said: I would just like to say this is not scary but inspiring, unique and beautul. Because this is who you are. This is so powerful, another fan added. Someone  commented: No offence but it kinda looks like your eye is breathing but your beautul. [sic] Emma also showed off her unique party tricks – which include blowing out candles with the hole in her socket. Now, the mum is focusing on continuing her recovery, which should involve a procedure taking a chunk of skin from her leg to cover the hole in her eye socket. title: woman saves mums life after
story: :root Woman saves her mums le after spotting suspicious mole on back of her armJoanne Elmes sent a picture of her mums mole to the doctors after becoming concerned about its size and colour - and checks later revealed her mother had an early stage of melanomaA woman saved her mums le after spotting this suspicious mole Image: Joanne ElmesByElliot BallMatthew DreschReporter:,  Sep | commentsA woman saved her mumaposs le by spotting a apossuspiciousapos mole on the back of her arm. Joanne Elmes said the mark looked like a textbook sign of cancer, prompting her to send a picture of it to the doctors.Her mum was then handed a two-week urgent referral for the mole to be removed, PlymouthLive reports.Doctors confirmed her mum had melanoma in situ - which is the earliest stage of skin cancer - and luckily the disease had not spread through her body. Joanne thought something might be wrong after noticing her mumaposs mole had a iation of colours with irregular borders. The dentist described the mole as looking just like the photographed examples of superficial spreading malignant melanoma.  Joanne and her fellow healthcare professionals have become the first line of defence in spotting skin cancer in patients after skin cancer charity Skcin rolled out an education programme in  aimed at those who work in the hair, beauty and healthcare industry. The thought process behind the roll out was that these iniduals would be spending a lot of time with customers or patients, meaning they would be perfectly placed to observe abnormalities or changes that may occur on their client’s or patient’s skin. Discussing how she was able to spot the early signs of skin cancer in her mum, Joanne said: I had seen a mole on the back of my motheraposs arm that looked dferent. I carried out closer inspection.  It was approximately mm in diameter, irregular borders, and iation of colours. I felt it looked just like the photographed examples of superficial spreading malignant melanoma given to me in my Pro training with Skcin. I took a photo of it next to a tape measure and my mother uploaded the photograph on an e-consult form to the doctors. She got a  week urgent referral and had it removed by dermatology. It has now been confirmed to be an aposin situapos melanoma and therefore has not spread thankfully. It was on the back of her right arm. Risk factors included: sun bathing when she was young, wearing olive oil and lemon juice on her skin, using sunbeds in her early twenties, and living in New Zealand for four years. Iaposve also encouraged my dad to go to the doctors which he now has a two-week referral as he has a suspicious lesion on his foot! Iaposve done so many more referrals as a dental therapist from before the training. Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter Since the early s rates of non-melanoma skin cancer has risen by % in the UK with cases expected to reach almost , by . The incidence of melanoma has risen faster than any other common cancer in the UK. According to Cancer Research UK,  in  males and  in  females will be diagnosed with melanoma during their letime and alarmingly, it is one of the biggest killing cancers in the - age group. However, the good news is that around % of all cases are preventable. It is also the only cancer we can physically see developing in it’s early stages, so with education, the hope is these statistics can reverse and save many lives. What Causes Skin Cancer Around % of all skin cancers are caused by overexposure to UV radiation from the sun and or sun beds. Sunburn, reddening, peeling and even tanning of the skin, is clear indication of sun damage. While many people associate a tan with looking healthy, a tan is actually a sign that our skin has been harmed by UV radiation and is trying to defend itself against further damage. Sunburn has strong links to melanoma. When we burn, the superficial layers of the skin release chemicals that cause the blood vessels to expand and leak fluid, causing swelling, pain and redness. Without sun protection UV radiation starts to penetrate deep into the layers of the skin, causing damage to the DNA in our skin cells. Damage from UV is cumulative and irreparable, therefore once the tan fades, the damage remains, which can result in serious consequences over time.  Is skin cancer risk determined by skin colour  We all have ying skin colours that respond dferently to UV radiation emitted from the sun. However, everyone, regardless of skin colour, can sunburn and accumulate sun damage, meaning we are all at risk from skin cancer. Melanin - the natural pigment that gives our skin dferent colours exists to help protect our skin from UV radiation. When we tan our skin is busy producing melanin to help protect it from the sun’s harmful rays. The darker our skin, the more melanin we have and the longer it takes our skin to burn. The paler our skin, the less melanin we have and the quicker our skin will burn. Although those with fairer skin who tend to burn more easily are at greater risk of skin cancer, the simple fact that our skin has changed colour is a sign of sun damage. Damage is permanent and cumulative, so the more we tan or burn, the greater our inidual risk of developing skin cancer. Whilst Caucasians are the primary victims of skin cancer - everyone, regardless of skin colour, can fall prey to it. It is a common misconception that people with darker skin colours are immune to melanoma. This is one reason why people of colour are diagnosed with skin cancer at later stages. Unfortunately, these delays mean that skin cancers are often more advanced and potentially fatal, whereas most skin cancers,detected early, are almost always curable. How should we protect our skin from UV radiation  Around % of skin cancers can be avoided by adopting simple sun safe strategies. Simply check the daily UV Index and when UV levels reach  or above take action to protect your skin by following Skcin’s Five S’s of Sun Safety:Slip on clothing Slop on sunscreen Slap on a sun hat Slide on sunglasses Shade from the sun What steps can we take to detect the early signs of skin cancer  Skin cancers seldom hurt and are much more frequently seen than felt. The sooner a skin cancer is identied and treated, the better a person’s chance of avoiding surgery, or in the case of a serious melanoma, potential disfigurement or even death. Getting to know your skin and regularly checking it thoroughly from head to toe, is the best way to spot any potential warning signs. Experts advise checking yourself once a month. There are lots of dferent kinds of skin cancers that can appear in many shapes, sizes and colours, so it’s wise to swot up on the ious forms and characteristics to understand what to look out for. However, as a general rule of thumb use the following checklist andyou detect anything of concern, seek immediate advice from your GP or dermatologist. If a new or existing skin, nail or mucosalpigmented or nonpigmented spot, lump, lesion, mole or freckle:Gets bigger and or changes in shape, particularly getting an irregular outline. Changes colour, gets darker, becomes patchy or multi-shaded. Becomes elevated, firm to touch and is growing. Starts to itch, gets painful, starts bleeding, gets crusty or becomes inflamed. Looks or is behaving dferently to the rest of your moles or skin lesions. Is evolving in any way, such as: changes in size, symmetry, surface characteristics or symptomsSkcin now have trained over  healthcare professionals, all who have embraced the opportunity to upskill and join Skcin’s in our fight to combat skin cancer and get skin cancers detected sooner and raise awareness and the profile of skin cancer in UK.To find out more about the work Skcin do you can visit their website here. For information about training courses for hair, beauty and healthcare workers, visit the link here. news uk-news woman-screams-horror-sea-creature-"TikTok user shows lump of mouldy fat she found in almond milkByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA woman was left screaming in horror after she said she discovered a mouldy mass resembling a sea creature inside a carton of Aldi almond milk. Nikky Afo claims she was horried when the grey blob flopped out the plant-based product. She shared the vile discovery on TikTok leading some viewers to promise they will never become vegan. The video, which has gone viral with .million views and counting, started with the caption: Aldi can you explain this  The womanaposs family can be heard howling in the background as cuts the almond milk carton to show the oyster-looking contents. A voiceover says: Aldi UK, we need answers. You will never believe what we found inside this almond milk carton. She then points out the use-by date, which is February , . The woman says: Look at this, holding the cartonaposs lid which is covered with gross-looking grey and blue mould. She continues: I just opened this and I could tell that there is something lumpy inside it. The woman explains how she can feel the blob sloshing in the packaging, before taking a pair of kitchen scissors to cut the carton open. She adds: Honestly, I always buy this milk but now I feel like throwing up everything I have had in the last year. Her family then bursts into nervous giggles as she tells them: Itaposs not funny honestly! As the grotesque blob emerges, another woman shrieks and runs back from the now-open carton. Nikky Afo also posted another video, showing the rank blob up close as she prods it with scissors. In the video, a voiceover explains: Aldi UK, we need answers. We bought this almond milk from the store and when my daughter wanted to make oats this is what she saw. It is still within the expiry date. Social media users flocked to the comments to share their horror at the minging mouldy milk. One said: I thought it was an octopus. Another jibed: Thataposs my ex. One viewer vowed: Iaposm eating cereal with water from now on. One joked: You got free lasagne with your almond milk. Be grateful! Another disgusted viewer said: Thataposs a whole sea creature. And another user advised: Donapost go vegan my friends. An Aldi spokesperson said: We apologise for any inconvenience this may have caused. We are trying to contact the customer to discuss this matter and offer further assistance. Although rare, incidents like this can occasionally occurthe packaging is damaged at any point before the product is consumed, as the contents may be exposed to air. The TV star is known for turning up at a Patriots-Giants Super Bowl press conference in  to tell then-Patriots quarterback Tom Brady that she loved him.  Brady rejected the woman dressed in full wedding garb - excusing himself due to a relationship to then-girlfriend Gisele Bundchen. The footballer and Bundchen were married in February , a month after their engagement. The spurned presenter moved on quickly to Giants quarterback Eli Manning with a T-shirt reading, Marry Me Manning. Local news reported that Mexicoaposs Attorney Generalaposs Office has requested Interpol issue international capture warrants for the couple. s _SWNS_CAR_FALL_.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"| commentsA top of the range Jaguar was totalled when it rolled off a delivery transporter and smashed into a truck. Video shows the high-end Jaguar F-type, worth almost , , being delivered to a customer. The car was clearly not loaded correctly and slides off the trailer and rolls down the road before smashing into a parked Chevy truck in Maine, USA. Melissa Morvey, from New Jersey, captured the expensive blunder on camera. She said: The car was being unloaded for a car transport delivery for a customer. The video shows the car clearly was not loaded correctly and fell off the tractor trailer into a Chevy truck behind it which completely destroyed the Jaguar. It was pronounced total by the insurance company and inoperable after the fall. I was in complete shock when I was filming the video everything happened so suddenly. The purchase price of the vehicle deemed by the insurance company was worth ,. . The estimated salvagewas ,.to ,. . Earlier this year a lawyeraposs Lamborghini - worth between £, and £, depending on the model - was smashed up outside his office by an angry woman with a hockey stick. A photograph of the luxury vehicle, thought to be Lamborghini Huracan shows the front windscreen smashed and shattered. The damage is reported to have happened outside the legal firmaposs office in Edinburgh, Scotland in August.One eyewitness told the Daily Record they saw an angry woman armed with a hockey stick carrying out the attack.Comment MORE ON Supercars" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: how meghan harry followed dianas
story: :root How Meghan and Harry are following in Dianas footsteps with New York visitDuring their trip to New York Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are staying at The Carlyle, a £-a-night hotel used by Diana and the Duke and Duchess of CambridgeMeghan, Duchess of Sussex and Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex visit One World Observatory at One World Observatory in New York City Image: Getty ImagesByLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Sep | commentsPrince Harry and Meghan Markle have carried out their first public engagement since welcoming baby Lilibet in a three-day visit of New York City that still gave a subtle nod to the couple’s royal roots. The Sussexes arrived in the Big Apple on Thursday, visiting a   memorial along with New York City mayor Bill de Blasio and the stateaposs governor, Kathy Hochul. While in New York, they have booked to stay at The Carlyle, known as New Yorkaposs “Tower of Power”, and have been spotted having a drink at the hotel’s bar. The Carlyle was known to be a favourite of Harryaposs mum Princess Diana, who often stayed there when she was in the city.  Diana first visited New York in February  as a royal for a three-day solo tour, and ed to the same hotel after her orce in , where she reportedly stayed in the ,-square-foot “Royal Suite” on the nd floor. According to the  documentary “Always the Carlyle”, the late Princess shared the hotel lt with Michael Jackson and Steve Jobs. Prince William and Kate Middleton also stayed at the hotel when they visited New York for a series of royal engagements in .  In another subtle tribute to the Princess of Wales, Harry and Meghan spoke about a subject that was also close to Diana’s heart. While touring the One World Observatory on Thursday, the couple spoke about mental health with Mr De Blasio. The New York City mayor said: “They’re good people and they’re really committed to the world. “I got a great vibe, particularly the work that they’re doing on mental health ... I think the prince makes a great point when he says, ‘mental fitness,’ calling it ‘mental fitness’ as a positive aspirational idea. That was one of the things we talked about. I really admire what they’re both doing on that.”  While she never set out to be an advocate for mental health, Diana had also broken royal barriers decades before by candidly discussing her own struggles with mental health, including postpartum depression, bulimia and self-harm. In a  interview with the BBC, she described her bulimia as “like a secret disease”. “You inflict it upon yourself because your self-esteem is at a low ebb, and you don’t think you’re worthy or valuable,” she said. “You fill your stomach up four or five times a day — some do it more — and it gives you a feeling of comfort.” She added: “It’s like having a pair of arms around you but it’s temporarily, temporary.”  She went on to say that the immense pressure to keep her marriage together left her “crying for help”, but that others used her eating disorder as “a coat on a hanger. “They decided that was the problem — Diana was unstable,” she said. In February , Diana paid a visit to Henry Street Settlement’s Urban Family Center in New York, which offers services and shelter for homeless families with children. During her visit, she met with a group of formerly homeless women who worked at the centre as well as a family who was living there at the time.  The organisation tweeted: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex are in town raising mental health awareness. It reminds us of Princess Diana’s memorable visit to Henry Street in !Writing for Curbed in , the centre’s chief administrator of homeless and transitional housing at the time, Verona Middleton-Jeter, described the royal visit: “She was interested in the problems of homeless women and families, and the program that we had, but she asked more questions about women who were in abusive relationships.”Harry and Meghan are due to appear at Global Citizen Live on Saturday in Central Park to urge world leaders to adopt a vaccine equity policy to help end the pandemic. During their visit the Sussexes, who now run their own charitable foundation Archewell, also met with the US ambassador to the United Nations, Linda Thomas-Greenfield.Writing on Twitter, the ambassador said they had an “important discussion” that included the pandemic, racial justice and raising awareness of mental health.When asked about herto New York, Ms Markle told reporters: “Itaposs wonderful to be back, thank you.” Comment MORE ON York City Football ClubBig Apple CompaniesBBCMeghan MarklePrince HarryMichael JacksonPrincess DianaSteve Jobs  attacksDocumentariesRoyal FamilyEating disordersMental healthFitnessHomelessness" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news us-news meghan-markle-given-new-nickname-"Meghan Markle says it is wonderful to be back in New YorkByJenner Newton:,  Sep | comments From the Duchess of Sussex to Meg, it seems like Meghan Markle goes by a number of names. And it appears that another moniker can be added to that list after she was given a new nickname during her appearance in New York yesterday.Meghan, along with Prince Harry, were at the One World Observatory in the city, on what was their first public appearance since moving to the U.S after stepping down as senior royals.During the visit, they met with New York City mayor Bill de Blasio, his we Chirlane McCray, their son, Dante and New York governor Kathy Hochul and posed for pictures with them. During the photocall, one reporter called out to Meghan to ask her how she was enjoying her trip to the Big Apple. But rather than call her Meghan, he referred to her as Madam Duchess. He said: Madam Duchess, are you enjoying your visit to New York  And Meghan replied: Itaposs wonderful to be back, thank you. Video shows Harry then turning to Meghan grinning and he appears to mouth aposMadam Duchessapos at her before they continue to pose for the cameras.Taking to Twitter, one fan wrote: Look from here on out it is Madame Duchess for me with #MeghanMarkle.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .Another said: Who besides me is really liking the title Madame Duchess Meghan  While another added: YASSSS! Madame Duchess Meghan Markle it is. Following their morning meeting at the One World Observatory, Meghan and Harry went to the   Memorial and Museum. Later they met with the US ambassador to the United Nations, Linda Thomas-Greenfield. Writing on Twitter, the ambassador said they had an “important discussion” that included talking about the pandemic, racial justice and raising awareness of mental health.Tomorrow, they will appear at the -hour star-studded global TV event Global Citizen Live on the Great Lawn in Central Park.At the event, they will continue their urgent work with world leaders in the pursuit of global vaccine equity to end the Covid- pandemic for everyone, everywhere. The event organisers call them two of the strongest voices on vaccine equity. news us-news prince-harry-meghan-markle-spotted-"Meghan Markle and Prince Harry visit One World Trade CentreByKate Buck:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsThe Duke and Duchess of Sussex have been spotted sipping cocktails with friends in a swanky New York bar the night before their first public event since quitting as senior royals. Meghan Markle and Prince Harry - as well as around  members of their security - descended on New York on Thursday to stay at the Bemelmans Bar in the £,-a-night Carlyle Hotel in New York City.The couple have left their children Archie, two, and three-month-old Lilibet at home in Calornia while they attend the three-day tour of the city. Witnesses said their body guards sat at tables around them trying to blend in while Meghan and Harry chatted with a blonde woman and brunette man.The pair stayed in the bar for around three hours before leaving via the back door, MailOnline reports.Meghan, , and Harry , are due to be in Big Apple this weekend to appear at the -hour star-studded global TV event Global Citizen Live in Central Park on Saturday. Making the most out of their journey, t hey today visited the cityaposs highest building - the One World Trade Center, built on the site of the former World Trade Center, and its One World Observatory.They arrived hand-in-hand with Meghan dressed in an all black outfit including what is thought to be an Emporio Armani coat, with matching black Aquazzura heels and her hair tied back off her face in a bun. Harry also wore a black suit  They met with New York City mayor Bill de Blasio, his we Chirlane McCray and their son, Dante. They also met with New York governor Kathy Hochul. Itaposs not yet known what they discussed during their morning meeting. Itaposs thought their sombre-looking outfits were chosen as they visited the   memorial afterwards. As they posed for pictures on the observation deck, Meghan was askedshe was enjoying her visit to New York and she replied: Itaposs wonderful to be back, thank you. Once the meeting was over, Harry and Meghan clutched each otheraposs hands as they walked to the   Memorial nearby. There they could be seen reflecting next to one of the memorial pools and looking at the names of some of those killed in the   terror attacks  years ago that are inscribed in the pools.  After paying their respects, it is reported that the couple then went to the   Museum, where they spent some time inside before leaving.The engagement is the first time Meghan has been seen in public since giving birth to daughter Lilibet in June while the trip also marks the coupleaposs first-ever joint visit to New York City.The couple will stay on in NYC until at least Saturday when they will appear at the Global Citizen Live event in Central Park.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . At the event, they will continue their urgent work with world leaders in the pursuit of global vaccine equity to end the Covid- pandemic for everyone, everywhere. The event organisers call them two of the strongest voices on vaccine equity.Both Harry and Meghan have spoken out about vaccine equity in the past and in May, Harry made an appearance at Vax Live - a concert in Calornia to promote the sharing of vaccines. The couple has also previously written an open letter to the chief executives of pharmaceutical companies like Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca urging them to redouble their support for the UN-sponsored Covax vaccine equity programme. Meghan was last in New York in early September , when she travelled to the city to support her friend Serena Williams in the US Open at Flushing Meadow. Harryaposs last trip there was in  when he toured areas devastated by Hurricane Sandy. news us-news staffy-nearly-put-down-five-"Baby cow kisses staffy in adorable momentByBethan ShufflebothamNiche Writer:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA Staffordshire bull terrier who was saved from being put to sleep is now best friends with a baby cow. The adorable duo have gone viral on TikTok after user @do.the.scarn shared a video of the couple kissing. Other dogs can be seen playing on the farm, but Elsie the heer only has eyes for the blue Staffy, called Momma. Everything about the clip will melt your heart, from the gentle dog letting the calf lick her face, to the cowaposs little pink sunhat. The TikToker saved the Staffy from being put to sleep with her five puppies, and ended up keeping her. TeamDogs is a community for dog lovers who want to get the most out of their relationship with their best pal. Make sharing the cutest photos of your dog your first job on the website and after youaposve done that, leave a tip to help fellow dog owners live their best lives as a proud pooch parent. She told her , followers: “Momma came to me and I fostered her and her five puppies several years back. They were all at Memphis animal control, in Tennessee, and they were all going to be put down that day - her and her five iddy biddy little babies. “So one of the shelters I worked with volunteered to get all of them and I housed them until all the puppies got adopted and Momma I decided to keep. “She was my very first foster, so now she’s been a part of the pack for about seven years now.” The pack, which also includes horses, pigs, Dalmatians and golden retrievers, live on a farm where the account documents their every day antics.  But it’s the sweet relationship between Momma and Elsie that people just can’t get enough of. The video racked up over , comments of people swooning over the grass puppy and land seal. title: throuple disowned family being ungodly
story: :root Throuple disowned by family for being ungodly now planning to raise a babyAmerican high school sweethearts Joel Forchue, , and Mickey Pagan, , brought Jaida Cutino, , into their relationship after meeting her on a phone app last year and Jaida Cutino " content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _PAY-h_MDRUM_Disowned_Throuple-.jpg" width"" "" Joel Forchue with his partners Mickey Paganand Jaida CutinoImage: @_throupletrouble mediadrumworldByJosie AdnittMatthew DreschReporter:,  Sep A aposthroupleapos who have been disowned by their families for their aposungodlyapos relationship are now planning to get pregnant. High school sweethearts Joel Forchue, , and Mickey Pagan, , met each other in Rhode Island in  when Mickey started attending the school Joel was at. They quickly took an interest in each other and started dating, staying together after high school and starting a le together. Mickey had always known she was bisexual and Joel would joke around with her, saying he was going to have aposfive wivesapos and aposbabies everywhere, of every nationalityapos. One day Mickey called his bluff and suggested they find a girlfriend. In September , Joel met Jaida Cutino, , on MeetMe, an app that allowed people to chat and make friends.  As Mickey listened to them chatting, she realised she also had common interests with Jaida. Over time, the couple would wait for Jaida to come online to chat to her and Jaida would wait for the couple. On November , , Mickey and Joel asked Jaida to be their girlfriend and shortly after, Joel got down on one knee and asked Mickey for her hand in marriage. To combat the jealousy that can arise in their relationship, the trio say they stay true to themselves and their intentions and remind each other that no one is loved more than the other.  When they have a moment of jealousy, they always reassure each other and make sure those thoughts donapost escalate. Despite their love for one another, Jaida and Joel have lost contact with members of their families over the relationship. Jaidaaposs mother no longer speaks to her and Jaida says she feels like sheaposs been disowned. Joelaposs mother also stopped talking to him, however he says the younger members of his family have been much more supportive. My family donapost agree with it, they say a man is supposed to be with one woman and thereaposs not supposed to be extra partners, said Jaida.  I used to get really upset and hurt about it because Iaposm a big family person and there was a point where I was really depressed and unhappy about the situation. I still hope one day theyaposll accept Joel and Mickey but I donapost see it moving in that direction. Sometimes my family will invite me to a party but tell me to come on my own and that I shouldnapost bring the people I love. The throuple say people tell them that theyaposre aposgoing to hellapos or that theyaposre aposungodlyapos but the trio hit back and say they go to church and pray before they eat, when they wake up and when they go to bed and feel incredibly close to God.  Being in a triad is like having two best friends and le partners instead of one, said Mickey. Weaposre never alone and thereaposs always someone  to talk to. We donapost see our relationship any dferent and go through le just like everyone . Thankfully my mum is very open and accepting, she says that she has four children now - she always used to call Joel her son and now she calls Jaida her daughter. I want people to know that weaposre all lucky, not just Joel, me and Jaida are lucky too.  People say weaposre not godly because of our relationship but weaposre incredibly close to God and try to be closer and closer every day. If one of us gets pregnant, Joel wants to get the other pregnant so we have kids at the same time and can go through the pregnancy together. We havenapost got anything planned - but at the same time itaposs kind of planned. The throuple say thereaposs no favouritism in the relationship and they all treat each other as equals. Joel and Mickey donapost let the time theyaposve spent together prior to meeting Jaida impact their relationship now. People ask us for advice or a better understanding of a polyamorous relationship but the truth is we donapost know because we didnapost plan for this, said Joel.  Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter The rude comments can be influenced by racism as well. I get called a pimp or people tell me Iaposm a big daddy or a big man when really thereaposs three of us in the relationship. There is no handbook, all polyamorous and throuple relationships are dferent with dferent rules. Itaposs about whataposs in front of you and living in the moment - we wanted something and we got it. Being in this relationship as a straight man, Iaposve started to understand what people in the LGBT community go through. It helps me be more empathetic and talk to more people about it. Eventually, Millie resorts to jamming her face right into the middle of where her big sisters are attempting to bite at each other, before ing to her early tactic of leg nibbling. title: chris pratt ruining relationship because
story: :root Chris Pratt is ruining my relationship because my boyfriend hates him so muchA woman said that she was happy with her boyfriend, but recently hes developed an unhealthy hatred for Chris Pratt and would go on hour-long rants about how terrible the actor isChris Pratt is adored by many, but apparently not everyone Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsA woman said that she was thinking about leaving her aposperfectapos boyfriend - because he hates Chris Pratt too much. Sharing her story anonymously, the woman said that she had been with her partner for three years and they were very happy together - but recently a problem had developed. She said that he had become irate about Chris Pratt, and hated the actor so strongly that he would go on hour-long rants about how terrible he is. The woman said that the problem reached a new height when her boyfriend discovered that the actor would star in the new Mario movie, and his reaction was so severe that she was now considering leaving him. What do you think about the boyfriendaposs actions  Let us know in the comments Taking to Reddit, the woman said: My boyfriendaposs unhealthy hatred of Chris Pratt is affecting our relationship.We have dated for years and he is so sweet and innocent. However, the one thing I canapost stand is how much he talks about hating Chris Pratt.He hated him in Parks and Recreation and even more in s of the Galaxy. Any mention of him always brings him in a bad mood and thataposs why he refuses to watch movies like Jurassic World, Lego Movie, and onward.Things went from bad to worse for the woman when the new animated Super Mario Bros film was announced, and it emerged that Chris Pratt would be the voice of the Italian plumber.She continued: He is a huge Nintendo fan and was looking forward to the Mario movie. When he heard Chris Pratt would be voicing Mario though he had a tantrum where he ended up breaking his Switch as a result. I tried to calm him down but he childishly accused me of supporting Chris Prattand ordered me to leave once I did not agree with his rants. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere.This seems so much like a minor thing but Iaposm not surethis is a healthy environment to be in. Heaposs sweet on other topics but Iaposm not sureI can deal with this behaviour anymore. After sharing her story online, other Reddit users were quick to offer advice to the woman. One said: There’s some sort of mental health issue going on here. This isn’t normal, but it is so out there and out of place otherwise that there has to be some sort of underlying condition. And another added: My uncle used to go on hour-long rants about trivial shit too, but he was bipolar and it was a facet of his illness. Your boyfriendaposs behaviour might be more understandablehe were struggling with some mental health issues. He either needs to figure out why this is such an intense issue for him and sort it out or stop talking about it entirely before he ruins his relationship.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: couple find hidden room house
story: :root Couple find hidden room in their house and transform it into bar area for just £Sarah King and her husband Toby were stunned to find a secret room hidden behind a wall in their home but theyve since transformed the space into their dream bar areaSarah found the outline of a doorway while painting their dining room Image: Jam Press @lewiththekings_ByCourtney PochinAudience WriterLaura Abernethy:,  Sep Updated:,  Sep | commentsWhen it comes to our own homes, you would assume we know them pretty well, after all we spend the majority of our time there. But one couple recently discovered a apossecretapos room hidden behind a wall in their house. Sarah King and her husband Toby were giving their property in Brighton a fresh lick of paint when they came across the faint outline of a doorway. Sarah, , said: We knew there was a void there, from the plans. The other houses along the road have got a cupboard therebut we had thought ours was completely bricked up.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.However, while prepping and sanding the walls of their dining room, they came across the outline and had to knowthere was anything more to the space. With Sarah still furloughed but Toby out at work as a technical support engineer, she had some free time on her hands. He went to work one day and I started chipping away the surface just to seethere was any way of finding out what was there, she explained. I just did a tiny bit then sent a photo to Toby - he was replying and happy for me to discover more. As I uncovered the lintel, I realised that it was not resting on the breeze blocks that were blocking the door. They weren’t supporting anything above.  Throughout the process, I was sending updates to Toby, who was cheering me on and friends and family too, who were getting excited to see what I would find in there! Sarah, who has recently launched her own interior design business, managed to chip through the wall and knew there was a room there, but held back until Toby finished work. Sarah said: I waited until Toby was home to make the final hit to smash down the breeze blocks – in case something was staring back at me! It was a tiny room with just a pull-out shelf desk, some knee pads and a car battery. It had electricity to it and believe it or not, hardly any cobwebs and thankfully no spiders. Once they found the room, the couple decided it was the perfect space for a bar area to entertain guests, as it sits just off their dining room. So they have transformed it into their dream bar for just £, mainly using materials they already had at home. The pair had just started work on renovating their dining room and decided to use the same paint in the bar. They then made cupboards for the wall with leftover wood they had from another project and also made a bar top from offcuts and wrapped it in marble effect vinyl. They added new handles to the cabinets and stuck mirror stickers to the back of the bar area to create a mottled glass look.To finish the whole thing off they managed to nab some glass shelves from Facebook Market place for free - bargain!Sarah added: We love it! We are so pleased with it and we love the story behind it of uncovering the space.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: incredible photo mum catches moment
story: :root Incredible photo by mum catches moment seagull ebombs son, , as he enjoys ice creamMum-of-three Kasia Holzer caught the shocking moment with son Hugo, , on camera, with a tragicomic series of photos leaving people in stitches at the unfortunate eventMum Kasia and son Hugo enjoy the autumn sunshine on Brighton Pier Image: Triangle NewsByRosaleen FentonAudience WriterLucas Cumiskey:,  Sep | commentsAudacious heists have always attracted huge amounts of attention, as weaposre gripped by the stunts required to pull it off. From the Great Train Robbery to the Hatton Garden Burglary, there have been some incredible daring raids during history. Now one daring seagull has risen to the top of the list, after their attempt to steal an ice cream was captured on camera. Photos show the brazen gull e-bombing a lad and successfully stealing the ice cream - without a single regret. Mum-of-three Kasia Holzer caught the shocking moment on camera, with a tragicomic series of photos. The first captures Hugo, , looking jubilant as he poses with a double cone Mr Whippy, smothered in chocolate sauce and adorned with two flakes.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.The next shows the cap-wearing lad happily scoffing at his treat, oblivious to the incoming airborne threat. But a dramatic third shot shows the greedy gull swooping down from behind to steal a mouthful of Hugoaposs ice cream while he was licking it. Luckily, the pesky bird didnapost steal his p flake - and Hugo didnapost get into a flap, as he continued to eat the rest of his ice cream after the bird flew off.  Kasia, , of Brighton, East Sussex quipped: Moved to Brighton from London three years ago now and probably should know better what those birds are capable of. I was just capturing him enjoying his ice cream while watching the sunset. Totally forgot that we need to watch out for the seagulls. I was so content in that moment. The bird only took a bite of the ice cream. Even missed a flake. Hugo decided to continue eating the ice cream: five seconds rule. He was in shock and he wasnapost impressed! Unsurprisingly, she admitted they are not keen on seagulls. Well, theyaposre not our favourite birds out there, she said. We love the sound of them, while indoors! She posted the hilarious snaps online and floods of people praised her photography skills and Hugoaposs bravery. What an amazing shot, said one woman. What a brave lad, too - Iaposd have run a mile and screamed the place down! Another added: What a totally fabulous capture - by the seagull AND the photographer. Amazing. Others shared their similar horror stories of how idyllic British beach days have been blighted by seagulls. One wrote: One took the whole ice cream from my husband. He was left with the cone. title: time traveller claims photo evidence
story: :root Time traveller claims to have photo evidence of what the future will look likeA man named Alexander Smith said he travelled from  to  on a top secret CIA mission, and took some pictures of a futuristic city that shows what we all have to look forward toAlexander Smith went to the year  on a top secret CIA mission Image: Apex TVByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Sep | commentsA man claims to be a time traveller who has visited the year  - and said that he has photographic evidence of what the future has in store. Alexander Smith said that in  he travelled to the future on a apostop secretapos mission for the CIA, adding that it was an experiment he would aposnever forgetapos. Speaking to Apex TV, he said that aliens will soon visit the earth and make contact with world leaders and that later World War III will break out after a conflict between the US and North Korea. To back his claims, Alexander took a photograph with him and presented it on air, and it appears to show a futuristic city with green skyscrapers.  What do you think about the photograph  Let us know in the comments... He said: I visited the year  as part of a top-secret CIA mission. As to my knowledge, it was one of the first times that time travel had successfully been completed. I went to the future and then back to the past. This happened in .
